Subbu Allamaraju wrote:
> I don't think so. The main take-away is not to process requests from 
> untrusted sources with unverifiable data. I would use one-time URIs to 
> deal with attacks like this.

So don't use query parameters at all? Interesting. Looking at the deck 
again it still seems the attack severity is related to putting actions 
into URLs as I can get the remote server to do something other than show 
me data.

Bill
